title: Daily Market Digest
subtitle: February 7, 2026: Weekend Market Wrap-up and Key News

sections.title: Market Pulse: Strong Friday Rebound Caps Volatile Week

items.headline: Dow Soars Past 50,000 as Market Recovers from Tech Sell-off
items.summary: U.S. equities concluded a turbulent week with a robust rally on Friday, February 6, 2026, as major indices rebounded sharply. The Dow Jones Industrial Average achieved a historic milestone, closing above 50,000 for the first time. The week had been marked by investor anxiety over the impact of new AI tools on software companies and a rotation away from growth stocks. While Friday saw widespread gains, the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite and the S&P 500 still finished the week slightly lower.

items.headline: Nvidia Soars on Tech Rebound
items.summary: Chip giant Nvidia ($NVDA) surged nearly 8% on Friday, recouping some losses from earlier in the week driven by renewed optimism in AI spending.

items.headline: Caterpillar Leads Dow Gains
items.summary: Construction-equipment maker Caterpillar ($CAT) surged 7% as investors rotated into industrials and value stocks.

items.headline: MicroStrategy Jumps with Bitcoin
items.summary: Shares of MicroStrategy ($MSTR) jumped 25% as Bitcoin rebounded after a midweek plunge.

items.headline: Stellantis Plummets on 'Reset'
items.summary: Automaker Stellantis ($STLA) saw its shares plummet 25% after announcing a business 'reset' involving a significant charge.

items.headline: Amazon Slides Post-Earnings
items.summary: Amazon ($AMZN) stock sank more than 5.5% following a disappointing earnings report released after Thursday's close.

items.headline: Molina Healthcare Leads Nasdaq Declines
items.summary: Molina Healthcare ($MOH) plunged 26%, leading Nasdaq decliners, following post-earnings movements.

items.headline: Hyperscalers' AI Spending Spooks Investors
items.summary: Major tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Meta Platforms have committed to spending a combined $565 billion on AI in 2026, a significant increase from 2025. This massive capital expenditure has raised concerns among investors about its impact on cash flow, leading to some underperformance of 'Magnificent Seven' stocks.

items.headline: US Imposes New Tariffs Related to Iran
items.summary: Effective February 7, 2026, the U.S. President authorized the imposition of tariffs, potentially up to 25%, on goods imported from any country that directly or indirectly purchases goods or services from Iran. This move aims to tighten economic pressure on Iran amidst ongoing diplomatic talks.

items.headline: Syria and Saudi Arabia Sign Multi-Billion Dollar Investment Deals
items.summary: Syria and Saudi Arabia signed several multi-billion dollar investment agreements on Saturday, February 7, 2026. These deals include a major telecommunications project, a joint low-cost airline, and the development of an international airport in northern Syria, aiming to boost Syria's economy post-sanctions.

items.headline: Qualcomm Announces 2nm Semiconductor Design Tape-out in India
items.summary: Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. announced on Saturday, February 7, 2026, the tape-out of its 2nm semiconductor design in India. This marks a significant milestone in advanced chip design, highlighting India's growing role in the semiconductor ecosystem.

items.headline: S&P 500 Q4 Earnings Season Update: Strong Revenue Surprises
items.summary: As of February 6, 2026, 73% of S&P 500 companies reported actual revenues above estimates, surpassing both the 5-year and 10-year averages. Information Technology, Industrials, and Communication Services sectors are leading in year-over-year earnings growth, while Consumer Discretionary and Health Care are lagging.
